intro: Wiborgia leptoptera subsp. cedarbergensis, commonly known as Cedarberg wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
